column4: FYI i have also experienced issues with sound and multiple virtual consoles/X sessions.  in fact the problem has gotten a lot worse in the last few versions of ?X/Pulse/audio/GDM/Gnome (not really sure where the problem comes from?).  good luck man.
it even was not a problem before. i think somewhere i did something wrong. i changed so mayn things. i don't think i can recover all steps i did.
lol - BEEN THERE!
so many times I can't "undo" all the steps I have done to something and broken it.
hm, i could your line a lyrics for a song ;P
if you're using fluxbox only - then pulse is not a factor.  consider this however, alsa doesn't share audio as well as pulse.
i am sure i didnt mess with sound stuff.
try running "pasuspender firefox" to disable pulse for firefox and test if that works.
it is not only FF it is the whole thing
try running "pasuspender firefox" to disable pulse for firefox and test if that works.
i had it on the system while i had all these troubles

with ubuntu-desktop it was
pulse is part of the "default" ubuntu-desktop package, i don't know why installing it would solve the problem (doesn't make a lot of sense, you might want to keep testing to verify)
the packages i stalled were 3 packages that have screensaver in their name. nothing about sond. anyway. it works :D thank you & bye
